articles.author: Nidal Al-Mughrabi, Steve Holland, Mohammad Salem
articles.description: The United States believes the remaining differences between Israel and Hamas can be bridged in negotiations over the Palestinian militant group's latest ceasefire proposal, as talks resume in Cairo on Wednesday.
articles.title: US optimistic revised Hamas proposal may break Gaza ceasefire impasse

articles.author: Tingshu Wang, Laurie Chen, Kevin Yao, Farah Master
articles.description: The generation that flocked to China's cities at the end of last century, building the infrastructure and manning the factories that made the country the world's biggest exporter, now risks a sharp late-life drop in living standards.
articles.title: In rapidly ageing China, millions of migrant workers can't afford to retire

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: The three men accused of murdering Canadian Sikh leader Hardeep Singh Nijjar last year in a killing that triggered a diplomatic crisis between Canada and India appeared briefly in a British Columbia courtroom on Tuesday.
articles.title: Three men accused in Canadian Sikh leader's death appear in court

articles.author: Renju Jose
articles.description: Australia said on Wednesday it would raise the amount of savings international students will need to get a visa and warned several colleges of fraudulent student recruitment practices, as part of efforts to rein in record migration.
articles.title: Australia raises minimum savings for student visa, warns on fake recruitment

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: U.S. soldier Gordon Black, who has been detained the Russian city of Vladivostok until July 2, has been charged with theft causing significant damage, a Russian court said.
articles.title: Russian court says US soldier charged with theft causing 'significant' damage

articles.author: Andrew Goudsward
articles.description: Donald Trump's trial in Florida on charges of illegally keeping classified documents after leaving office has been indefinitely postponed, a judge decided on Tuesday, greatly reducing the odds he will face a jury in either of the two federal criminal cases against him before the Nov. 5 U.S. election.
articles.title: Trump documents trial start delayed indefinitely, judge orders

articles.author: Kate Abnett
articles.description: The world just experienced its hottest April on record, extending an 11-month streak in which every month set a temperature record, the European Union's climate change monitoring service said on Wednesday.
articles.title: World's record-breaking temperature streak extends through April

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: Taiwan's military is prepared for any moves China may make around the time President-elect Lai Ching-te takes office later this month, the island's deputy defence minister said on Wednesday.
articles.title: Taiwan says its military is ready for China moves around new president's inaugural

articles.author: Pavel Polityuk, Gleb Garanich
articles.description: A Russian air attack on Ukraine damaged several facilities in a strike targeting energy infrastructure across the country, Ukraine's military and energy officials said on Wednesday.
articles.title: Russia targets energy facilities in air attack on Ukraine, officials say
Payments in focus as prosecutors make their case in Trump hush money trial
